title: Liao dynasty
summary: The Liao dynasty (/ljaʊ/;[3] Khitan: Mos Jælud; traditional Chinese: 遼朝; simplified Chinese: 辽朝; pinyin: Liáo cháo),[4] also known as the Khitan Empire (Khitan: Mos diau-d kitai huldʒi gur),[5] officially the Great Liao (Chinese: 大遼; pinyin: Dà Liáo), was an imperial dynasty of China that existed between 916 and 1125, ruled by the Yelü clan of the Khitan people. Founded around the time of the collapse of the Tang dynasty, at its greatest extent it ruled over the North China Plain, Manchuria, the Mongolian Plateau and the northern part of the Korean Peninsula.[6]
